meanings.definition: To completely surround or cover something
meanings.sent1: The flames were engulfing the entire house.
meanings.sent2: The fog was slowly engulfing the city, making it hard to see.
meanings.sent3: The blanket was so big that it was engulfing the tiny puppy in a cozy embrace.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the night was engulfing the world, swallowing everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The tsunami was engulfing the coastline, leaving nothing but destruction in its wake.

meanings.definition: To overwhelm or consume something completely
meanings.sent1: The feeling of sadness was engulfing her heart.
meanings.sent2: The loud music was engulfing all other sounds in the room.
meanings.sent3: The delicious aroma of the freshly baked cookies was engulfing the entire house, making everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: The sense of panic was engulfing the crowd as they realized they were lost in the maze.
meanings.sent5: The excitement of the upcoming trip was engulfing her mind, making it hard to focus on anything else.
